title: French AI firm Mistral expects $1.2 billion in 2026 revenue
description: French generative artificial intelligence developer Mistral should top one billion euros ($1.2 billion) in revenue this year, chief executive Arthur Mensch said Thursday at the World Economic Forum in Davos.
content:
Synopsis
French generative artificial intelligence developer Mistral should top one billion euros ($1.2 billion) in revenue this year, chief executive Arthur Mensch said Thursday at the World Economic Forum in Davos.

title: Artificial Intelligence: Revolutionizing Every Aspect of Life - Telangana Embraces AI and Renewable Initiatives at WEF
description: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is rapidly redefining the way we live, work, and interact. No longer confined to the realm of science fiction, AI is now a driving force behind innovations across all sectors— from healthcare and finance to entertainment and manufacturing. Its impact is far-reaching, transforming industries, reshaping economies, and influencing the way we navigate daily life.

title: Google offers users option to plug AI mode into their photos, email for more personalized answers
description: Google is leveraging its artificial intelligence technology to open a new peephole for its dominant search engine to tailor answers that draw upon people’s interests, habits, travel itineraries and photo libraries
content:

title: Using AI to solve your tech problems | Column
description: Artificial intelligence, such as Claude or ChatGPT, can be helpful (if imperfect) in helping you solve your tech issues.
content: You can’t listen to a radio or TV news program or read a newspaper without running across an article about some aspect of artificial intelligence (AI). Much of the debate centers around questions about losing jobs to AI, misinformation and deepfakes ... [5782 chars]

title: OpenAI Chair Bret Taylor says AI is “probably” a bubble, predicts market correction
description: The AI gold rush may be getting overheated. Bret Taylor, chairman of OpenAI’s board and co-founder of customer service startup Sierra, says the frenzy around artificial intelligence looks a lot like a bubble. Speaking at the World Economic Forum in Davos, he didn’t mince words. The flood of capital pouring into every layer of the
